kc.title: Wine Traffic
kc.author: André Hentschel

intro.p: This is the 373rd issue of the World Wine News publication. Its main goal is to inform you of what's going on around Wine. Wine is an open source implementation of the Windows API on top of X and Unix. Think of it as a Windows compatibility layer. Wine does not require Microsoft Windows, as it is a completely alternative implementation consisting of 100% Microsoft-free code, but it can optionally use native system DLLs if they are available. You can find more info at www.winehq.org

kc.section:
In 2011 I wrote:
The main reason for this proxy is to be able to run some win32-only pcap applications like the
IEC 61850 Demo Software from systemcorp.
or many others like Asn1Browser, Cain & Abel, Gamer's Internet Tunnel,
PacketVB (and PacketVB based Apps), SharpPcap based Apps and maybe coLinux in the future.
Of course non-win32-only Apps will work fully too, like Wireshark, but that's just a cool side effect.
But shortly after that Qian Hong unveiled some more use cases (Network Authentication Clients mostly used in Universities) and also enhanced my code with e.g. packet.dll.

section.title: Further statistics
section.p: Jeremy White shared a permanent link to his Wine test analysis which sums up the Wine test runs.
On another topic I presented a list of bugs which are not yet linked to our AppDB (including a lot of false positives). It lists 7786 at the moment.

p.i: *Disclaimer: These lists of changes are automatically generated by information entered into the AppDB. These results are subject to the opinions of the users submitting application reviews. The Wine community does not guarantee that even though an application may be upgraded to 'Gold' or 'Platinum' in this list, that you will have the same experience and would provide a similar rating.
